page.title: 02British Aerospace
page.content: A group of children visited Aerospace on Wed.12 June.We discovered that it is both a civil and a military works. The frames for Concorde were made here and the engines were tested at the Rolls Royce Works nearby .The aircraft had a successful test flight in the 1960's.An early Concorde now minus it's engines is still to be seen. American F111s,swing wing jet fighters are often seen.They are serviced at Aerospace.Small single engined Chipmunks are used as training aircraft by University students attached to the R.A.F.Aerospace has a good reputation for manufacturing aircraft wings. Last year there was an air display of many famous aircraft of the past,including the well loved Spitfire .
